page.title: 14RIVINGTON COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The people of Bolton have never lost the large expanse that Lever left. It has been maintained in varying condition since l925 but latterly has been formed into a modern country park with the necessary environmental controls. One major problem in the post war era was the damage caused by increasing traffic use of the area,not least in the mounds of litter,some of it dumped and the ever widening verges gouged out by parked cars. The Country Park has now provided new car parks with toilets and a gradually improved surfacing and landscaping.The public appear to be increasingly won over to the correct use of the areas and this promises well for the continued preservation of this favourite rural escape for the folk of Bolton.
